title: Israel-Hamas:  How Le Monde navigates the image war
summary: This conflict, even more than others in the past, raises the question of where photos come from and how they are used. Whether for the newspaper's print or digital editions, Le Monde's editorial team is constantly faced with crucial choices.

title: Hamas releases additional hostages hours before truce set to expire
summary: Hamas released 10 Israelis and four Thai nationals to the Red Cross. Israel in return released 30 Palestinian prisoners. Two Russian-Israeli women were freed separately earlier. International mediators are scrambling to extend the expiring ceasefire.

title: Court clears French justice minister in conflicts of interest case
summary: Eric Dupond-Moretti was accused of having used his powers to settle scores with opponents from his career as a lawyer.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Hostages share initial accounts of their captivity
summary: Some of the liberated hostages recounted details of their daily lives at the hands of Hamas to relatives, the media and doctors. They were reassured by their general state of health.

title: 2030 Winter Olympics: French Alps designated as the sole candidate
summary: The International Olympic Committee supported France's bid over Sweden and Switzerland, while only Salt Lake City bid for the 2034 Winter Games.

title: The growing trend of students shunning alcohol: 'In the end, I told myself it wasn't worth it'
summary: While student and early professional life are associated with drinking-centric outings, some young people are abstaining. They say sobriety allows them to reconnect with themselves and others.

title: US charges Indian man for alleged assassination plot on American Sikh activist
summary: According to US prosecutors, an Indian government official orchestrated a scheme to assassinate a notable Sikh separatist leader residing in New York City, unveiling charges against an individual allegedly involved in the foiled assassination plot.

title: US Vice President Kamala Harris will attend COP28
summary: Harris will join the US delegation to Dubai for the annual United Nations conference on climate change, the White House said Wednesday. The announcement comes after criticism of Joe Biden's decision to skip the summit.

title: Champions League: Lens crushed by Arsenal while Manchester United draw with Galatasaray
summary: Arsenal's 6-0 victory on Wednesday ended Lens' Champions League campaign. Meanwhile, Manchester United squandered a two-goal lead, settling for a 3-3 draw with Galatasary, while Jude Bellingham scored as Real Madrid secured the top spot in Group C with a victory over Napoli.

title: For those left in one Ukrainian front-line town, 'no one dares to claim that we will survive'
summary: From 30,000 before the war, the number of inhabitants of Avdiivka, a front-line town  in the east of the country, fell to 1,600 after the Russian invasion in February 2022. Today, only a few hundred remain. Food and medical supplies are running out.

title: COP28: For the US, the climate battle will be won with oil companies, not at their expense
summary: Joe Biden will not be attending the 28th United Nations Climate Change Conference, which opens in Dubai on November 30, a sign of the country's changing stance in the run-up to the 2024 presidential election.

title: The lack of weather information increases climate risks in Africa
summary: The continent has the least dense observation network on the planet, which compromises its ability to anticipate extreme weather phenomena.

title: Forever chemicals found in the blood of residents of one French town
summary: Despite high levels of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) detected in the water of the southeastern town of Rumilly back in 2017, the authorities have neither acted on this information nor alerted residents.

title: Israel says investigating Hamas report of baby hostage death in Gaza
summary: The armed wing of Hamas claims that a 10-month old baby, his brother and their mother have been killed in an Israeli bombing before the current truce.

title: Erdogan calls Netanyahu 'the butcher of Gaza'
summary: The Turkish president also accused the Israeli prime minister of inciting anti-Semitism across the world.

title: As population is declining in Russia, the right to abortion is under attack
summary: In the name of defending 'traditional values,' and at a time when the population is shrinking, many politicians are increasingly attacking the right to abortion and challenging women's liberation and right to work.

title: Henry Kissinger, former Secretary of State, has died at 100
summary: A German Jewish emigrant, 'Dear Henry' held some of the most important positions in the United States from 1968 to 1977, including Secretary of State under Nixon. He used secret diplomacy in a search for compromise, notably in Vietnam and the Middle East.

title: Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia hit by unprecedented floods
summary: The floods have claimed at least 260 lives and displaced more than one million people, according to provisional figures from the three countries.

title: Josephine, the slave-owner who whispered in Napoleon's ear
summary: Ridley Scott's biopic, released on November 22, sidesteps a debate that divides historians: born in Martinique into a family of wealthy landowners, did the future empress push her husband to re-establish slavery overseas in 1802?

title: Before the war, Gaza's emigration to Europe was booming
summary: In 2023, Palestinians were the largest group of new asylum seekers on the Greek islands. They came via Turkey, where they were easily granted access to visas.
